qas.question: In what year were digital and physical music sales the same?
How many CDs had been distrubuted worldwide by 2007?

plausible_answers.text: they remain one of the primary distribution methods

qas.question: Why are CD sales doing better than digital storage services?
How have CD sales changed internationally?

context: In 2004, worldwide sales of audio CDs, CD-ROMs and CD-Rs reached about <a4_0>30 billion<a4_0/> discs. By <b7_0>2007<b7_0/>, <a1_0><a3_0><b6_0>200 billion<b6_0/><a3_0/><a1_0/> CDs had been sold worldwide. CDs are increasingly being replaced by other forms of digital storage and distribution, with the result that audio CD sales rates in the U.S. have <b9_0>dropped about <a2_0>50%<b9_0/><a2_0/> from their peak; however, <b8_0>they remain one of the primary distribution methods<b8_0/> for the music industry. In <a0_0><b5_0>2014<b5_0/><a0_0/>, revenues from digital music services matched those from physical format sales for the first time.
